channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Costco sales run higher after yet another monthly sales gain, helped by digital demand
item.description: Costco Wholesale Corp. on Wednesday said it notched an 8% year-over-year sales gain through last month, continuing its streak of sales gains and easin...

item.title: AMD’s stock builds on its historic rally as the AI trade heats up again
item.description: AMD’s stock is enjoying its best three-day run since 2016, and one analyst sees a nice path ahead.

item.title: Meme-stock ETF is back from the dead. Last time, its launch coincided with the 2021 market top.
item.description: The ETF’s biggest holding is Opendoor, a name that has sparked comparisons with the meme-stock explosion of 2021

item.title: The government shutdown won’t stop the IRS from fining people who miss this key October tax deadline
item.description: The shutdown might delay the 2026 filing season’s start, one expert notes.

item.title: History says bitcoin could peak soon, but here’s the case for it to keep climbing
item.description: Bitcoin may hit a peak soon if its four-year cycle still holds true. But one analyst argues that the boom-and-bust cycle may no longer apply,

item.title: This Wall Street strategist thinks small caps are ‘inferior.’ Where to pick your spots
item.description: Small caps may have climbed to all-time highs, but investors shouldn't expect a repeat performance, according to Trivector Research.

item.title: Santoli's Wednesday market wrap-up: The usual flag carriers of the AI boom push S&P 500 to new highs
item.description: While stocks tied to the AI buildout are booming, those closer to the here-and-now consumer remain sluggish.

item.title: Consumer stocks are underperforming. This one looks like it's ready to bounce

item.title: These beaten-down stocks may have further to fall as investors sell to save on taxes, says Morgan Stanley
item.description: With the end of the year approaching, investors are assessing their winners and losers, and may sell some of those beaten-down names to save on taxes.

item.title: JPMorgan's top short ideas into year-end include a popular restaurant stock and once-hot chipmaker
item.description: JPMorgan pointed to Shake Shack, Southwest Airlines and Skyworks Solutions as some of the best stocks to target for short sellers.
